description:
'''Punk jazz''' is a genre of music that combines elements of [[jazz]], especially improvisation, with the instrumentation and performance style of [[punk rock]]. The term was first used to describe [[James Chance and the Contortions]]' 1979 album ''[[Buy (album)|Buy]]''. Punk jazz is closely related to [[free jazz]], [[no wave]], and [[loft jazz]], and has since significantly inspired [[post-hardcore]] and [[alternative hip hop]].

Notable proponents of the genre include [[John Zorn]], [[Arto Lindsay]], [[Elliott Sharp]], and [[James Chance]], among others.
